title: Rights Policy Constraint Compiler
reason: We need this skill because operations must preserve rights and satisfy jurisdictional obligations. This specific skill turns governance language into enforceable runtime checks.
implementationGuide: Define the scope and success metrics for `Rights Policy Constraint Compiler`, including at least three measurable KPIs tied to rights violations and compliance penalties.
Design and version the input/output contract for requirements mappings, legal decisions, and evidence trails, then add schema validation and failure-mode handling.
Implement the core capability using rule compilation, and produce executable policy bundles with deterministic scoring.
Integrate the skill into swarm orchestration: task routing, approval gates, retry strategy, and rollback controls.
Add unit, integration, and simulation tests that explicitly cover rights violations and compliance penalties, then run regression baselines.
Deploy behind a feature flag, monitor telemetry/alerts for two release cycles, and iterate thresholds based on observed outcomes.

validationGates.check: All required input signals present and schema-valid
Repeated run on same inputs yields stable scoring and artifacts
Approval gates satisfied before publish-level outputs

knownFailures.action: Reject payload, emit validation error, request corrected payload
Freeze output, escalate to human approval router
Apply retry policy then rollback to last stable baseline

produces: Rights Policy Constraint Compiler normalized artifacts
